content: crochet balloon dog a lot of people love balloon animals but they always have an unfortunate tendency to pop or deflate over time so why not make a more long-lasting version this cuddly plush has a beginner-friendly pattern and makes a perfect companion for any dog and/or balloon lover materials ● 5mm crochet hook ● worsted weight yarn about 200g ● polyester fiberfill ● yarn needle you can use whatever yarn and hook size you d like just be aware that it will change the size of the finished product i used the materials above and my plush measures 8 ½ inches long and 8 inches tall abbreviations single_crochet = single_crochet increase = increase stitch decrease = decrease stitch pictures of the finished product can be found at the bottom of page 3 tail make a magic_ring with 6 single_crochet row 1-4 single_crochet around 6 this is the uninflated part at the tip of the tail increase or decrease number of row to your preference row 5 increase around 12 row 6 repeat row 5 24 pull yarn end from the magic_ring tight and weave in before continuing row 7-16 single_crochet around 24 row 17 decrease around 12 stuff segment to preferred firmness row 18 decrease around 6 row 19-22 single_crochet around 6 legs row 23 increase around 12 row 24 repeat row 23 24 row 25-38 single_crochet around 24 row 39 decrease around 12 1 stuff segment to preferred firmness row 40 decrease around 6 row 41-44 single_crochet around 6 repeat to make the second hind leg ending on row 66 body row 67 increase around 12 row 68 repeat row 67 24 row 69-78 single_crochet around 24 row 79 decrease around 12 stuff segment to preferred firmness row 80 decrease around 6 row 81-84 single_crochet around 6 repeat legs pattern 2 more times to make the front legs ending on row 128 with a total of 6 segments so far neck row 129 increase around 12 row 130 repeat row 129 24 row 131-138 single_crochet around 24 row 139 decrease around 12 stuff segment to preferred firmness row 140 decrease around 6 row 141-144 single_crochet around 6 ears row 145 increase around 12 row 146 repeat row 145 24 row 147-156 single_crochet around 24 row 157 decrease around 12 stuff segment to preferred firmness row 158 decrease around 6 row 159-162 single_crochet around 6 repeat for the second ear ending on row 180 head row 181 increase around 12 row 182 repeat row 181 24 row 183-190 single_crochet around 24 row 191 decrease around 12 2 stuff segment to preferred firmness row 192 decrease around 6 row 193 single_crochet around 6 row 194 increase around 12 secure yarn end and cut tail long enough to weave in twist to form a dog shape as one would with a balloon ohana craft amigurumi has a good visual guide for this here https //youtu be/hdbpn5b3a20 once twisted you can sew the joints for extra stability
